item.title: Korey add a quote by Ayn Rand
item.description: "The question isn't who is going to let me; it's who is going to stop me." -- Ayn Rand

item.title: Korey add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Those who believe in telekinetics, raise my hand." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Korey add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "We are what we pretend to be, so we must be careful about what we pretend to be." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Korey add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "Isn't it enough to see that a garden is beautiful without having to believe that there are fairies at the bottom of it too?" -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Korey add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "I refuse to answer that question on the grounds that I don't know the answer" -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Korey add a quote by David Foster Wallace
item.description: "I have filled 3 Mead notebooks trying to figure out whether it was Them or Just Me." -- David Foster Wallace

item.title: Korey add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "We burn daylight." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Korey add a quote by John Lennon
item.description: "Reality leaves a lot to the imagination." -- John Lennon

item.title: Korey add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "The purpose of a writer is to keep civilization from destroying itself." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Korey add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Nobody realizes that some people expend tremendous energy merely to be normal." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Korey add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Idleness is fatal only to the mediocre." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Korey add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "It is the job of thinking people not to be on the side of the executioners." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Korey add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "An intellectual? Yes. And never deny it. An intellectual is someone whose mind watches itself. I like this, because I am happy to be both halves, the watcher and the watched. "Can they be brought together?" This is a practical question. We must get down to it. "I despise intelligence" really means: "I cannot bear my doubts." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Korey add a quote by steve martin
item.description: "I believe entertainment can aspire to be art, and can become art, but if you set out to make art you're an idiot." -- steve martin

item.title: Korey add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "Here's what I think, Mr. Wind-Up Bird," said May Kasahara. "Everybody's born with some different thing at the core of their existence. And that thing, whatever it is, becomes like a heat source that runs each person from the inside. I have one too, of course. Like everybody else. But sometimes it gets out of hand. It swells or shrinks inside me, and it shakes me up. What I'd really like to do is find a way to communicate that feeling to another person. But I can't seem to do it. They just don't get it. Of course, the problem could be that I'm not explaining it very well, but I think it's because they're not listening very well. They pretend to be listening, but they're not, really. So I get worked up sometimes, and I do some crazy things." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Korey add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "It's like Tolstoy said. Happiness is an allegory, unhappiness a <i>story</i>." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Korey add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "But who can say what's best? That's why you need to grab whatever chance you have of happiness where you find it, and not worry about other people too much. My experience tells me that we get no more than two or three such chances in a life time, and if we let them go, we regret it for the rest of our lives." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Korey add a quote by Chuck Klosterman
item.description: "There are two ways to look at life. The first view is that nothing stays the same and that nothing is inherently connected, and that the only driving force in anyone's life is entropy. The second is that everything pretty much stays the same (more or less) and that everything is completely connected, even if we don't realize it." -- Chuck Klosterman

item.title: Korey add a quote by Hunter S. Thompson
item.description: "America...just a nation of two hundred million used car salesmen with all the money we need to buy guns and no qualms about killing anybody else in the world who tries to make us uncomfortable" -- Hunter S. Thompson

item.title: Korey add a quote by Hunter S. Thompson
item.description: "Sane is rich and powerful. Insane is wrong and poor and weak. The rich are free, the poor are put in cages. Res Ipsa Loquitur, amen. Mahalo." -- Hunter S. Thompson

item.title: Korey add a quote by Hunter S. Thompson
item.description: "THE EDGE, there is no honest way to explain it because the only people who really know where it is are the ones who have gone over." -- Hunter S. Thompson

item.title: Korey add a quote by Hunter S. Thompson
item.description: "I hate to advocate drugs, alcohol, violence, or insanity to anyone, but they've always worked for me." -- Hunter S. Thompson

item.title: Korey add a quote by Lewis Carroll
item.description: "Be what you would seem to be - or, if you'd like it put more simply - never imagine yourself not to be otherwise than what it might appear to others that what you were or might have been was not otherwise than what you had been would have appeared to them to be otherwise." -- Lewis Carroll

item.title: Korey add a quote by Joseph Heller
item.description: "He was going to live forever, or die in the attempt." -- Joseph Heller

item.title: Korey add a quote by Joseph Heller
item.description: "where are the snowdens of yesteryear?" -- Joseph Heller

item.title: Korey add a quote by Orson Welles
item.description: "The absence of limitations is the enemy of art." -- Orson Welles

item.title: Korey add a quote by Orson Welles
item.description: "I don't pray really, because I don't want to bore God." -- Orson Welles

item.title: Korey add a quote by Dave Eggers
item.description: "And there is a chance that everything we did was incorrect, but stasis is itself criminal for those with the means to move, and the means to weave communion between people." -- Dave Eggers

item.title: Korey add a quote by Dave Eggers
item.description: "Still though, I think if you're not self-obsessed, you're probably boring." -- Dave Eggers

item.title: Korey add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "You can lead a horticulture, but you can't make her think." -- Dorothy Parker
